11.content:
Houki gave off a rather large size. Sitting by herself in the rather spacious dining hall of IS academy, she had been rather down in the dumps lately. Slumping further down into the circular booth, the only thing on her mind was a certain boy. A boy that she had been enamored with since they were children, someone who she loved, but he only saw her as a close, yet somewhat violent friend. Since their almost 'kiss' around a week ago, the girl fell into her current depressive state, believing that Ichika truly did not see her as a woman. Letting out another deep sigh, Houki picked at her half-eaten meal with her chop-sticks, not feeling all that hungry at the present moment. It was a rather simple and efficient Japanese meal as well, not too many calories, while giving her the correct amount of nutrition as well. To anyone else however, it would look like something incredibly boring to consume. Without her noticing, Ichika strolled into the dining room. The room itself was rather empty, most of the other students had finished their lunch ages ago. Since the Gospel incident, all use of IS units had been prohibited, until the exact causes of the catastrophe could be analyzed. It also didn't help that IS usage became more unpopular with the general populace of the world as result of the experimental unit going rouge.

With his new-found free time, Ichika found himself able to do all of his old hobbies again that he needed to cut down on since his arrival at the prestigious school. One of his favorites past-times was cooking/baking as he did quite a lot of it during his childhood. Though lately it seemed that he could only bake sweet confections rather than creating actual meals. Maybe his other skills had deteriorated over time? Deciding it was best to not mull over such details, he tried to find Houki in the common space. Last time he heard, she was moping around in the room. Noticing that she had been rather down in the dumps lately, Ichika wanted to bake her a small cake to cheer her up. Holding a white container in his hands, he put quite a lot of effort into making such a treat, using the right amount of frosting, attaining a very moist spongy cake and even getting fresh fruit from the gardening club to use as toppings. A few minutes went by of the special teen scanning up and down the rows of booths and tables until he actual found the girl. He hadn't seen Houki in a few days and her appearance slightly shocked him. Bags under her eyes, her hair not done up in her usual ponytail cascaded down her back, and a demure expression made her look quite cute to anyone really, but it made Ichika concerned.

"Yo." was all that he need to say. Surprised at the sudden noise, she looked up to see Ichika's warm and smiling face. Almost immediately she had an urge to give him a warm smile in return, but maintained her sullen disposition.

"Oh Ichika it's you."

"Don't you 'oh Ichika it's you' me. Don't you say hi to your friends anymore?" teased her crush. Of course the word 'friend' hurt the most.

"I'm sorry, I've just been tired lately."

"Hey, don't take it personally, I was just teasing you a bit. I brought you a present today. Here open it." Ichika slowly place the small container in front of her. Surprised, she looked at Ichika and then back towards the container. Opening it, she saw that it was a cake. This cake had strawberry frosting adorned with actual strawberries and spelled out 'For Houki' in blue frosting. The sight of such a treat made the girl frown somewhat. She was never one for sweets and the calorie-filled pastry would ruin her perfect diet as well. Closing the small box, she pushed it towards Ichika.

"Sorry, I don't do sweets." By her words, his expression became a bit downfallen.

"Are you sure? I made it especially for you! And you didn't even taste it yet."

"I'm sure. I do appreciate the thought." And once again, she stared back into her half-eaten meal. Most of it had surely gone cold by now.

"Ah fine, if that's how it's going to be. Anyways I'll be off, I'll give this to Cecelia if you don't want it." Houki's ears peaked at that last part. Cecelia? What does she have to do with any of this?

"What? Why would you give it to someone else?" Ichika found the question a tad bit weird. What was the problem in giving away the cake?

"Well you don't want it. Cecelia likes my baking a lot and I thought she might like this one too." At the piece of info, something clicked inside Houki's semi-oblivious mind. If another girl liked his baking at ate his creations regularly then that would mean that they would be spending more time with him! Also they would make Ichika very happy too! She knew from experience that nothing made the teen happier than seeing other people enjoying his food. She had been such a fool! Why hadn't she had realized this earlier?!? Reaching out to the box in Ichika's hands, she forcible took it and placed it back in front of her.

"On second thought, you made this for me so it would be the courteous thing to eat it. No need to bring in anyone else. Especially that girl...' said the girl as she mumbled the last part of her sentence. Ichika's expression brightened and he took a seat right next to her. Her face flushed from the proximity, but as usually, Ichika was too dense for such things. Taking the small fork from inside the box, she began to dig in, Bringing a forkful to her mouth, she slowly placed it into her mouth. As soon as she did, a burst of flavor hit her very being. It was delicious! Incredibly so! Strawberries, cream, sugar any kind of flavor hit her palate all at once. She turned to Ichika, a grand smile on her face and a small tear in her eyes.

"T-This is incredible! How did you make it taste so unbelievable?"

"Well practice I guess. Go on then, eat the rest of it!" said Ichika, responding kindly to the flattery. With gusto the girl ate the sweet confection. Bite after bite, she wished the cake would never run out. Around 10 minutes later, she disappointingly found the container empty. Houki felt rather full at the moment too, who knew such a food could be that filling? Ichika sported a wide smile. He truly did love seeing people enjoy his food so much. Staring at the girl, she seemed transfixed at the empty box, though he noticed she had traces of frosting still on her defined chin and around her mouth. Taking out a handkerchief from his breast pocket, he motioned the girl to come closer to him.

"I-Ichika?"

"C'mere, you have frosting all over your face." said the boy as he presented the small piece of cloth. Blushing, she went in closer, her heartbeat increasing at his gesture. Bringing the cloth to her face, he gently cleaned the residue from it. Gentle motions up and down, left and right, he made sure to leave no trace.

"There all finished. I'm glad to see you like it so much!"

"Yeah i-it was pretty g-good." stuttered the 'warrior' as her face still tingled from his touch. Ichika made himself stand up from the seat. One of his shows was coming up and now he actually had the free time to watch it. However Houki quickly grabbed his lone hand with both of hers.

"Houki?"

"Ichika, do you mind if we do that again sometime? I really liked doing this with you." She dared not look into his eyes, a look of vulnerability made itself obvious and she doubted that he would appreciate such a 'pathetic' expression. Ichika warmly smiled at her. He didn't know why, but he found it cute when she acted shy like this. Using his free hand, Ichika gently lifted her face to look at him. At this point her face as red as it could be but she enjoyed his touch oh so much.

"Of course Houki. Anytime you want." said the boy in a soft tone. He felt it was important to spend time with her, just enough to return her to regular 'Houki' levels. She acted quite weirdly during these past moments. Releasing his hold right after, she did the same to his hand. Waving goodbye, he left her in the room, he left her with a warm sensation flooding her body. Her face still red, she slide back into her seat, her mind still quite fuzzy.

'Cakes don't have too many calories right?'

Ichika himself felt a tad bit weird hanging out with the girl. He couldn't place it, but it was nice simply being with her. Really nice.

'Maybe I should ask her to watch my shows with me next time? Does enjoy soap operas?' wondered the boy as he made his way down the hall back to his dorm. He had to think this one over.

Blueberries...

As soon as the doughy substance hit the taste buds of her mouth, the girl gave off an audible gasp. Just like the day before, this culinary confection of Ichika's was a delight to one's palate, the different flavors of the pancake acting in perfect harmony. Houki could have sworn that she was tearing up a tad, the blueberry flavor slowly over taking her mind. Her face shifting towards a shade of red, she turned to Ichika, an amazed look to her.

"I-Ichika, this is, this is! I c-can't even describe it!" exclaimed the 'warrior' girl who felt as if she was in a state of pure bliss. Ichika stereotypically rubbed the back of his head in embarrassment, a small laugh accompanied the motion. He did enjoy getting praise for his cooking as he never received any during his lonely childhood. And getting such compliments by Houki, the often crass girl, made him feel all the better. Shaking these thoughts out of his rather dense mind, Ichika paid his attention back to his stack of blueberry pancakes. The teen gave himself about 3 of them, while he shoveled the rest of them to Houki, giving her a rather large stack on the white plate. Placing a piece in his mouth, the flat-screen TV in front of the two began to blare the opening credits of 'Fantastic Reality' showing off all of the main characters while playing the cheesy theme song in the background. Ichika grew excited by the sight of his anticipated program starting, while Houki still remained unimpressed. The characters themselves look rather cliche, the song was horrible and the main female love interest looked plain as a daisy in a flower field. Finishing one pancake, she moved on to the second of several of them, savoring each and every gram of her meal.

"Ha, I told you. It looks pretty great right?" said Ichika in an excited tone, clearly enjoying himself.

"Y-yeah, I can see why you were looking forward to it." lied Houki, still not seeing the appeal of the program. She simply continued to eat, happy that this was all it took to be able to spend time with her crush.

"So you like romance shows huh?"
-------------------------------------------------------

An hour had passed and the show started to show the credits, accompanied with another theme song. It only took a few commercial breaks for Houki to truly admire such a show.

"Ichika! This show! I must watch more!" proclaimed Houki as she turned to the boy, giving him a pleading face. The girl was very close to his face, obviously making him nervous. In the past, whenever she would be that close, she would often strike him with all of her strength.

"I-I have some other dvds of shows that are similar to this if you'd wanna watch. Hell, I'd even let you borrow them too." said the black-haired student, still quite nervous from her proximity.

"Um! I'd like that very much Ichika!"said Houki, giving Ichika a quick hug as a result of her excitement over these shows and the pancakes she had finished a few minutes ago. Realizing what she was doing, she quickly released her hold, her face burning with her self-inflicted embarrassment. Looking away from Ichika, she failed to see that he was also quite flushed, not that accustomed towards receiving such affection. Once again, he felt his heart skip a beat, and finding himself to be questioning the emotion he was currently experiencing.

"Anyways, your plate is empty, want another helping Houki?" He pointed to her desolate plate, all that remained was traces of sticky syrup plus small grams of blueberries. At the moment, Houki did feel quite full, but she could never deny Ichika or he'd most likely share the food with one of the other girls. If she wanted to win, she needed to make Ichika the happiest.

"Yeah, I'd love more." replied the girl in a quiet tone. Giving off a beaming smile, he rose from his comfy seat on his sofa, gathered both of their plates and utensils and headed back to his favorite place, the kitchen.

"Oh Houki! There's a show coming up next that you might like too! It has a female lead, thought there's more than one love interest. It's called 'Lover's Game' and it's pretty popular with girls apparently." While the last show did not interest her until she got to the 'meat' of the soap opera, this premise intrigued her greatly. This time around the credits were much more upbeat, suggesting that the program would be more light-hearted compared to the previous soaps that the brown-haired girl had seen earlier this day. The credits soon ending and the show finally started, opening up with the male main character waking up in his small dorm-room. Soon after, a girl with small dog ears on the peak of her head, complete with an energetic wagging tail burst into the room and attacked the still drowsy hero, wrapping all her limbs on him, causing him to stumble to the ground.

'That looks like a nice maneuver...' thought Houki, grabbing a handful of chips this time around, the crumbs spilling around on her uniform top. Watching the rest of the intro, Houki understood the premise of this quirky show. Essentially the protagonist, an everyday teen who was thrust into a world of monsters upon his 18th birthday after he discovered his lineage of famous magi. Bearing this impressive gift, he was sent to an eastern branch of an academy which enrolled various students with supernatural backgrounds. Now this included every type of 'supernatural being' from witches, to werewolves to even zombies! As per usual for this type of show, this main character finds himself attracting a variety of 'monster girls' who become smitten with him in various events. The main heroine was a werewolf, who looked oddly familiar to Houki. Long brown hair wrapped with a red ribbon, she was very affectionate in private, but tended to shy away from her feelings when the two were out an about in the school. The girl continued to watch the episode, deeply enjoying the plot and character interactions. She couldn't help herself from routing for the werewolf girl for some reason though. The episodes continued on as Houki munched and munched away. By the mid-point of the third showing, the bag of chips was emptied, it's contents digesting inside Houki's stuffed tummy. Houki found herself drifting off into a deep sleep relatively quickly, her body lethargic from the mass quantity of food she had consumed. Hours and hours passed as the girl snoozed the rest of the day away. Slowly stirring, Houki hazily got up into a sitting position on her comfy bed. Giving off a rather loud yawn, complete with her stretching out her arms in the air, Houki then looked towards her window, noticing that it was pitch black outside.

'What? Did I sleep for that long?' though the confused girl to herself, turning over to get a better look at her alarm clock. The digital number blinked 8:30. Letting out a disappointed sigh, and dropped back into her bed. How could she have overslept like that? Granted she didn't set the alarm clock to awaken herself well before her dinner with Ichika as she simply fell into sleep readily after being helped into her room, but to miss such an important event like this, it simply made her angry at herself for such a stupid action. Staring up at her blank ceiling, she thought of what Ichika did after she failed to show up.

'He probably found Charlotte or Cecelia to have dinner with him. Gaaah! Why did I mess up this badly?' Wallowing in her self pity, she stayed like this for a few more minutes, thinking of Ichika feeding Cecelia a creamy eclair, or having 'fun' with Charlotte. Steadily getting up, she decided to at least change out of her academy outfit if she was going to mope around. Removing her top and skirt, revealing her white undergarments, Houki slipped on a black long sleeve shirt and a pair of white sweats. Taking off her bright red ribbon, Houki let her long hair flow freely. Going over to her small refrigerator, she pulled out a carton of her favorite flavor of ice cream, cookie dough, which she would treat herself too whenever she was feeling blue. Sitting at her wooden desk, Houki then dug into her 'meal' of the night. The taste was good, but not as good as Ichika's cooking, which the 'warrior' girl greatly lamented. It went on like this for some time, with the girl simply satisfying herself to something sweet. Before she knew it, her clock read 9:00.

'I might as well just go back to sleep...' thought Houki, resting her head on the wooden surface. Despite her long rest, the weariness of it all slowly enveloped her. Closing her eyes, she suddenly heard a knocking towards her door. Groaning at the fact that she couldn't drift off, the student stumbled out of her chair, motioning towards the source of the current annoyance. Opening the door with a look of great annoyance, she soon changed that face as she saw just who was interrupting her peace.

"I-Ichika! W-What are you doing here?!" In front of her was said teen, with his ever present goofy smile.

"Hm, well I didn't want to be THAT kind of person, but when you were late to dinner, I kinda wanted to check up on you. Y'know to make sure you were okay and such." honestly answered Ichika. While he was somewhat concerned that she failed to show up, he didn't want to be seen as 'clingy' or whatever that meant. Houki however, greatly appreciated the thought. Though at the time she was somewhat embarrassed by her current state of dress.

"Ichika..., well I ended up oversleeping that's all. I only woke up around an hour ago, but I figured you were already eating dinner with someone else, so I didn't bother showing up. I'm glad that you came to check up on me though..." she trailed off, slightly reddened by giving her excuse.

"Wait, eating dinner with someone else? Who could I possibly eat dinner with?" asked the male, clearly confused by her fears.

"Eh? Didn't you say that you cook for Cecelia sometimes? And you mentioned Charlotte when you were cooking your pastries earlier today."

"Well I just make food for the others sometimes. I don't really eat with them that much I guess. You're the only one I tend to have dinner with though."

"R-Really?! I mean, really?" Even at this point, she felt her heart beating faster and faster by his naive words. Was she the only part of their group that got the wonderful luxury of sharing meals with Ichika?

A stern look was looking back at her at she couldn't find the courage to look him in the eyes. Of course her rival's words hurt to hear. What girl doesn't find her weight to be a touchy subject?

"...well yes it did." Was all that this girl said. Ichika found this explanation to be extremely lacking. Grabbing her shoulders with a firm grasp, the sudden movement cause her to look up at him. He gave another sigh as he began to explain something to his close companion.

"Listen Houki. If you're hungry, you are hungry. There's no getting passed that fact. And if you are hungry, then you are allowed to eat whatever you want. Something like weight and figure aren't that important if you're suffering from malnutrition." These words were starting to convince her, however a single thought on the extreme side of the spectrum called to her attention.

"What about if I get fat? That's certainly the other health concern to go with the want to eat whenever you're hungry." This of course caused him to think more about his own reasoning. A sudden click in his mind and the answer came to him. Looking down at Houki, his smile returned as bright as ever.

"As long as you're healthy, than something as trivial as weight has no importance when you think about it." This obvious statement hit her hard, but one other thing still needed to be answered. This exchange of their was coming to a close, and the outcome could easily change the way that they were.

"What about you? As a guy wouldn't you automatically prefer a thinner girl compared to a heavier girl, personalities aside?" While designed to have a deep impact on the teen's philosophy, her reasoning had little impact on him; rather it confused him a bit.

"Why would a person's weight matter at all? If they're nice then I know that we'll connect no matter what." What? What was he saying? It was common knowledge that all men go for the smaller women. Hell, an entire bulk of their society was built on that simple notion.

"So would you say that you would date a heavier person? And were not talking simply chubby either! No, someone that's around 200 lbs! Would you honestly claim to date them? And what about the physical aspect of it? Would you really be fine that when you would hug her, all of her fat would surround you?" said Houki, her rapid fire questioning slightly confusing her friend. Ichika of course thought the answer was obvious.

"As long as I like them, I'll like them, regardless of that. I will say that I don't really know much about the physical aspect of being with a larger person, but I do think that I wouldn't mind. I find the basis of attraction to be in the person's personality, rather than their physical body." he answered honestly. Houki was stunned by the way he answered each on of her queries. To actually say the opposite of what she expected, was something that she'd never believe to occur. One last question hovered in her mind; one that was perhaps the most important one to ask.

"What about me? What if tomorrow I was suddenly much fatter than I am right now? How could you expect me to believe that nothing will be different between us?" She dared not look at his face for fear of his answer. Of course things would be different, there's no getting around that, but she wanted to hear what he thought. After a few short moments of consideration, he had his answer.

"Nothing. Nothing would be different. Houki is Houki and nothing is going to change that ever." Another form of reasoning that cause Houki to become speechless. She wanted to talk, to say anything right now, but for some reason, she could not. Before her mind processed it, she pulled him in closer, wrapping her arms around his midsection. Being the kind of person he is, Ichika wrapped his own arms around her. Houki found her mind becoming clouded, the world slowly becoming smaller and smaller until it only included her and Ichika. She enjoyed this warmth that spread through out her entire body; the feeling being quite intoxicating as she held him tighter. It was a given that Ichika was a bit confused, but holding the girl in his arms was something that he enjoyed greatly, though he could not place his mind on why. As he felt her grab him tighter, he gave off a small chuckle which grabbed her attention. Looking up at him, she gave him a shy smile, a bit of a red shade adorned her cute face. This simple look of hers, caused his mind to freeze for a second. A sudden urge to built up inside him, but he knew he had to control himself. They did not share that kind of relationship. Slowly relasing his grip on the girl, she did the same as well. A small smile was made between them as the two followed the hallway towards the spacious dining hall. Opening the door to the room he gestured that Houki entered first. Stepping inside, they both noticed that there was a sparse amount of students present; it was slightly early after all, and what was the point of having a break so early into the day?

"So Houki-pouki, what do you feel like eating?" he asked, playfully using that nickname of hers. In return, she playfully shoved him.

"Well anything sounds good when you're hungry, but have a craving for some Chinese food."

"Ha, Chinese eh? Don't tell me you're turning into Rin now are you?" This earned him another playful shove, albeit a bit of a more forceful one.

"Mou, now you're comparing me to your second childhood friend? Isn't the first good enough for you?"

"Ha you know I was just kidding. Of course I prefer you to Rin!" said Ichika with a sincere tone. The pair soon went to gather their meals and found a nice booth to sit in; both of them sitting a bit close to each other. The lunch itself was somewhat uneventful. No other rivals showing up, no interference from other students and his sister didn't even scold them for having such an early lunch. Houki had an order of General Tso's Chicken, a traditional dish, while Ichika ate Sweet and Sour Chicken, to the slight annoyance of Houki. That dish reminded her too much of the promise between Ichika and the other girl. Comparatively quickly, Houki finished her meal while Ichika was only halfway done. Though Houki still felt a bit more hungry. A side effect of being Ichika's taste tester perhaps? Seeing that she had finished her meal relatively quickly, Ichika asked her if she wanted to go for seconds. Blushing a bit, she said yes and made her way back to cooking station to procure another dish of General Tso's chicken. While he didn't say it out loud, he found it funny when his dear friend acted out of character. Looking towards his watch, he noticed that he only had a few minutes before the start of his next class. Rising up from the seat, he gather his tray and headed over to the garbage can to dispose of his garbage. He then headed back over to Houki.
